container.heading: Driver's License Suspension and Restrictions for Child Support Noncompliance

section.heading: Scope.
section.text: This chapter contains procedures governing driver's license and driving privilege suspensions and restrictions imposed for child support noncompliance, pursuant to Transportation Article, §16-203, and Family Law Article, §10-119, Annotated Code of Maryland.

para.text: In this chapter, the following terms have the meanings indicated.
Terms Defined.
"Administration" means the Motor Vehicle Administration.
"CSEA" means the Child Support Enforcement Administration of the Department of Human Services.
"Gainfully employed' means:
To have employment with private industry or a government agency, or to be self-employed;
If not self-employed to have to complete an Employee Withholding Allowance Certificate (Form W-4, Internal Revenue Service); and
To file State and federal income tax returns.
"Work-restricted license" means a driver's license issued for the purpose of driving:
Directly to and from a scheduled work shift at the individual's place of employment;
During scheduled work shifts in the course of employment; or
When purchasing motor vehicle fuel or providing general maintenance for the individual's vehicle being driven for employment purposes.
"Work-restricted privilege" means the privilege to operate a motor vehicle in the State for the purpose of driving:
Directly to and from a scheduled work shift at the individual's place of employment;
During scheduled work shifts in the course of employment; or
When purchasing motor vehicle fuel or providing general maintenance for the individual's vehicle being driven for employment purposes.

section.heading: Notice of Suspension.
section.text: A notice of a proposed suspension by the Administration of an individual's driver's license or driving privilege for child support noncompliance shall:

para.text: Be in writing;
Be personally served on the individual or sent by U.S. mail to the individual at the address of the individual on record with the Administration;
State the duration of the suspension; and
Advise the individual:
Of the right, within 10 business days of the notice date, to file a written request for a hearing before the Administration, and
That any hearing shall be limited to the issue of mistaken identity.

A work-restricted driver's license may be issued or work-restricted privilege authorized by the Administration if the individual certifies that the individual understands the restriction conditions set forth in §B of this regulation.
Conditions of Work-Restricted License or Privilege.
Individuals shall be gainfully employed.
Individuals shall operate a motor vehicle only for the purposes described in Regulation .02B(4) or (5) of this chapter, and may not operate a motor vehicle for any other purpose.
A work-restricted license or privilege shall be valid only when no other suspensions, cancellations, revocations, refusals, or disqualifications exist against the individual's driver's license.
A work-restricted license issued under this chapter shall be cancelled by the Administration if:
The Administration receives notice from CSEA to remove the work restriction; or
The driver's license of the individual is suspended, cancelled, revoked, or refused, or the individual is disqualified.
